availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis M. Wolford (Somerset, Kentucky, mathematics teacher and soldier)

body.p: Somerset, Kentucky, mathematics teacher and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John Wolford and Mahala Wolford. Married to Maria J. Bradley Wolford in Pulaski County on August 10, 1863. Mathematics teacher in Somerset in 1860. Second lieutenant, first lieutenant, adjutant, and captain in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from October 28, 1861, to July 31, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Somerset, District 1, p. 3.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pulaski County Marriages, Film #000804052, p. 201.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 2-3.
